blocks.title: Help Stop the Spread of COVID-19 in Your Community
list: Get alerted if you recently spent more than 10 minutes within 6 feet of someone who tests positive.
Alert others if you test positive.
Keep an eye on trends in your community.

introduction.disclaimer: **We don’t collect info that can identify you. Your identity and location are always confidential.**

permissions.title: Set Up Closeness Sensing for COVID Alerts
permissions.line1: This app needs your permission to:
permissions.track:
**Sense when another phone with this app is close by.**

If another app user spends 10 minutes within 6 feet of you, your phones swap random codes to remember the contact. These codes don't say anything about you or your location.
permissions.notifications:
**Send you notifications.**

If the other app user tests positive for the virus within the next few days, the app can send you a COVID Alert after checking your codes.
permissions.subtitle: The app never:
permissions.statement: You can change your mind at any time by going to App Settings

completion.title: Closeness Sensing and COVID Alerts are now active!
completion.text: Thank you for doing your part to stop the spread of COVID-19.
completion.shareText:
Share this app with friends.
 Help keep NY Safe.

tour.title: How it works
statements:
As you go about your day, the app uses Bluetooth to sense when another person with the app has come within 6 feet of you.

Your phone exchanges a secure random code with the other phone to record that they were near. The app doesn't collect or share your name, location, or phone number, or those of the people around you

If you are within 6 feet of someone for more than 10 minutes, the app puts their phone's random code on a list of close contacts.

People who are just passing by or stand more than 6 feet away from you are not put on the list of close contacts. You will never get any alerts because of them.

If you test positive for COVID-19, a Health Advisor will call you as soon as possible.

The Health Advisor will ask if you are willing to share your app's list of close contacts to help protect other people.

Sharing your list is secure and private. The app never reveals who you are to anyone.

Each day, the list of "infected" codes is sent to every phone that has the app. The app compares its own list of close contact codes to the list of infected codes. If there's a match, the app displays a COVID alert.

Using these lists of anonymous codes, the alert is kept private. No one ever knows who the COVID Alert comes from.

checker.title: My Health Log

symptoms.subtitle: Do you have any of the following 11 symptoms today?
symptoms.fever: Fever or feeling feverish (such as chills, sweating)
symptoms.breath: Shortness of breath or difficulty breathing
symptoms.taste: New loss of taste or smell

results.title: Thank you
results.noSymptomsFeelingWell:
**Thank you for today's log. We're glad to hear you're feeling well!**

Even if you still feel OK, please come back tomorrow to let us know how you're doing.
results.riskGroup:
Because of your age, we would like you to take extra care to protect yourself from COVID-19.

We know this isn't an easy time. If you need support or advice on how to manage at home, tap below for more information.
results.noSymptomsNotFeelingWell:
**Thank you for today's log. We're sorry to hear you're not feeling well.**

Fortunately, you didn't report many symptoms. If you continue to feel unwell or get any new symptoms, talk to your health care provider or call the NYS Health Hotline at 1-888-364-3065.

If you'd like to get tested, contact your health provider or schedule an appointment at a publicly accessible testing site. 
Find a site near you.

Please remember to come back tomorrow to let us know how you're doing.
results.coronavirus1:
**We're sorry to hear you're not feeling well. Unfortunately, the symptoms you've reported today may be signs of COVID-19.**

If your symptoms are mild, remember that most people can recover at home without medical care.

However, we recommend that anyone with COVID-19 symptoms should take the following steps to protect the health of themselves and others:

**Please stay at home.** Avoid contact with other people (even your family) to help keep them from getting sick.

**Contact a health care provider.** Call your doctor or the NYS Health Hotline at [1-888-364-3065](https://www.google.ro/).

**Get tested.** Talk to your health care provider or schedule an appointment at a publicly accessible testing site. 

[Find a site near you.](https://www.google.ro/)
results.callEmergency:
If it's an emergency,
call 911 right away.
results.coronavirus2:
Signs of an emergency include:

  * Trouble breathing
  * Persistent pain or pressure in the chest
  * New confusion
  * Inability to wake or stay awake
  * Bluish lips or face

checker.noresults: You haven't tried the symptom checker yet. Start now by tapping the button above

welcome.title: Hi there 👋
welcome.text:
You can use My Health Log to track how you're feeling each day and get basic advice about your symptoms. Your phone stores a history, which you can review at any time.

The daily logs from you and other app users are shared anonymously with the NY Department of Health. Your symptoms data helps them understand how COVID-19 is affecting NY.

Your identity stays private, but you can share basic details like your age, gender identity, race, ethnicity, and county to make the information more useful for public health analysis.

**Note:** My Health Log is optional. You don't have to participate to use the other features of this app.
welcome.action: Yes I'd like to start my log
welcome.letUsKnow:
Let us know if you have
symptoms today

leave.title: Delete My Data
leave.info:
Thank you for helping us fight the spread of COVID-19 in NY. We’re sorry to see you go, but you can stop using this app at any time.

When you tap the “Delete My Data” button below, we’ll remove all the data that the app stored on your phone, such as all entries in your health log.
leave.summary:
**Note:**

This button doesn’t delete the random codes created or collected by your phone for Closeness Sensing and COVID Alerts.

To delete the random codes, go to your phone’s Settings and select “Google Services & Preferences.” Then, select “COVID-19 Exposure Notifications” and tap the “Delete Random IDs” button. To stop storing new codes, you should turn off “Use Exposure Notifications.”
leave.confirmText: Are you sure you want to delete your data?
leave.error: There was an error deleting your data. Please try again or contact us.

yourData.title: Your data
yourData.info:
The COVID Green app protects your privacy and does not share personal information about you with other app users. **Your identity will never be revealed to other app users.**

Any personal data you provide will be processed in line with GDPR and data protection law. You can read more about this in the Data Protection Information Notice below. **Your data will only be used in relation to the COVID-19 pandemic response** as set out in the Data Protection Information Notice.

If you need to be alerted, the app will start this process with a secure in-app notification. Separate to using this app, the HSE contact tracing team may phone you if someone with COVID-19 identifies you as a close contact. If you have a COVID-19 test, the HSE will contact you by text or by phone with results.

Take care with any suspicious phone calls, emails or texts asking you for personal information. **The HSE will not ask you for personal information by text or email.**
yourData.viewInSettings: You can view this notice at any time in Settings. If you do not want to continue, close and delete the app. If you consent, tap Continue to proceed.

sorry.title: Sorry to hear
sorry.info: Unfortunately you won’t be able to use the app any further. You can rejoin at any time. Just tap the back button.

ageRequirement.notice: You must be 16 or older to use this app

underAge.title: Under 16
underAge.notice:
Thank you for your interest but unfortunately you are too young to participate in this initiative.

Keep safe.

followUpCall.title: Contact Tracing follow-up call
followUpCall.intro: If someone you've been in close contact with tests positive for COVID-19, the app will send you a Close Contact Alert.  The HSE will also phone you if you provide your number below.
followUpCall.note:
The HSE may also phone if you are identified as a close contact by manual contact tracing. The HSE will give you advice and refer you for testing if appropriate.

The app will only share your phone number with the HSE if you get a Close Contact Alert. You can enter your number below, or add it later in Settings.
followUpCall.noteAlt:
If someone you've been in close contact with tests positive for COVID-19, the app will send you a Close Contact Alert.  The HSE will also phone you if you provide your number below.

The HSE may also phone if you are identified as a close contact by manual contact tracing. The HSE will give you advice and refer you for testing if appropriate.

The app will only share your phone number with the HSE if you get a Close Contact Alert. You can enter your number below.
followUpCall.noteSettings:
If you want we will try to call you to provide further assistance after you receive an exposure notification.

Your phone number will only be shared with the HSE if you get an exposure notification.

closeContact.title: COVID Alert
closeContact.intro:
**The app has detected that on September 1st 2020 someone who tested positive for COVID-19 was too close to you for too long.**

To protect others it would be best to **stay at home**.

A Health Advisor can help you find support for staying at home and getting a test.
closeContact.infoCard: Learn how to keep others safe

underAge.title: COVID Alert
underAge.intro:
**We can’t call you back because you’re too young.**

You must be 18 years or older to let us collect personal information like your phone number.

Instead, you can:

closeContactInfo.title: How to Keep Others Safe
closeContactInfo.info:
**To limit the risk of spreading COVID-19 to your family and community, please take the following precautions until you’ve been cleared by a public health professional:**

1. **Isolate yourself.**
Stay in a room or living area that has its own bathroom and keep other people out. If you're in a home with other people, make sure there’s a door to separate the area from the rest of your home and keep it closed. If you must share a bathroom, have plenty of cleaning supplies (like household disinfectant wipes, bleach) to clean all surfaces after each use.

2. **Stay at home and don’t leave your property.**
Don’t go out into public. It’s important to avoid contact with other people, even your family.

3. **Secure your living area.**
Keep others from entering without your permission.

4. **Wash your hands often.**
Make sure you have access to a sink with soap, water, and plenty of paper towels.

5. **Sleep by yourself.**
If you are in quarantine with others, sleep in separate bedrooms. You could start to have symptoms while you sleep.

6. **Have food brought to you.**
Don’t leave your living area to get or prepare food.

7. **Bag up your garbage and leave it outside your door. **
Ask someone else to pick it up regularly. (No special handling is needed.)

8. **Keep a supply of face masks.**
Wear one if you start to have symptoms or must come in contact with others.

9. **Monitor your temperature and symptoms carefully.**
You can keep track of them in the 'My Health Log' feature of this app or another way. A daily log helps Health Workers figure out the most effective treatments for you if you get sick.

10. **Call ahead if you must leave to get health care.**
Tell the health care provider about your exposure to COVID-19. Wear a mask when you go and avoid using public transportation, such as subways, buses, or taxis.

success.text:
Our health workers are helping many New Yorkers.

We will call you as soon as we can at (917) 485-1028.

While you wait: Protect others by staying at home

Thank you for sharing your codes. You may have just saved many people in your community from getting COVID-19.

Your public health representative will offer support and do their best to help you plan what to do next. They’ll check in with you daily to see how you’re doing.

appUsage.title: App Metrics
appUsage.info:
The HSE would like to understand your use of the App for the purpose of improving it.

The app will collect anonymous metrics about how you use the app and the effectiveness of Contact Tracing processes.

This information is gathered by the HSE directly and does not use any third parties to gather metrics. **This information is only gathered with your consent and cannot be used to identify you.**
appUsage.settingsInfo: If you change your mind, you can change these permissions in Settings at any time.

metrics.title: Help Improve This App
metrics.info:
You can help the New York State Department of Health improve this app by sharing data about how you use it and how well Closeness Sensing is working.

**When you turn this setting on**, the app sends your usage data directly to the New York State Department of Health. The data is anonymous -- the app doesn’t send anything about your identity. No third parties collect or see any of this data.

**If you keep this setting off or turn it off later**, the app keeps your usage data private and doesn’t send it to anyone.

tracingAvailable.text:
App can't alert you right now.
Set up My COVID Alerts.

positiveResult.title: If you test positive for COVID-19
positiveResult.text1: If you test positive for COVID-19, the first thing you should do is **stay at home** and **isolate yourself** to keep others safe.
positiveResult.text2:
A public health representative will call you as soon as possible. They’ll offer you help with getting medical attention and dealing with challenges you may face, such as how to get food and medicine while you’re isolating.

The representative will also ask if you’re willing to share your app’s list of close contact codes. If so, the app can send an anonymous COVID Alert to other app users who recently spent more than 10 minutes within 6 feet of you.

Sharing your list is secure and private. The app never reveals who you are to anyone.
